intro: Parrya saxifraga, commonly known as the Sierra stonecrop, is a perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its compact, succulent-like foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often at high elevations. Its leaves are usually fleshy and arranged in a rosette pattern, which helps it conserve water. Parrya saxifraga produces small, white or pale pink flowers in late spring or early summer.
